p: Plants were typically found on the northeasterly exposures with an average azimuth of 91.64 ± 11.18° and on granite outcroppings with 55.77 ± 7.92° slopes. Most H. brandegeei plants were flowering, while fewer had not produced flower buds yet or had already set seed. Individual plants produced anywhere from 1 to 142 flowers (median = 22, mean = 24.5 ± 1.92 SEM). H. brandegeei cushions had a maximum width of 20 ± 2.87 cm (mean ± SEM). This included cushions that spanned large portions of both shaded and exposed crevices and fissures (Supplemental Figure S1). Other species that were frequently observed in associated with H. brandegeei included S. monocephala, P. wheeleri, S. asprella, S. niveum, S. martirensis, M. wootonii and S. pulvinatus.
